The claim is based on an article from th: the Daily Caller, which cites the work of Christopher Conover, a scholar at the Center for Health Policy and Inequalities Research at Duke University and an adjunct scholar at the American Enterprise Institute.
Conover: s work predicts that if Obamacare is fully implemented, at least 129 million Americans with private health insurance coverage (68 percent) will not be able to keep their previous health care plans.
Beck: s claim of 125 million people losing their health insurance is based on Conover's estimate, which represents about 40 percent of the population of the United States, not 50 percent as claimed by Beck.
Conover further explains that out of the: only 18 to 50 million will actually lose coverage entirely, while the rest will retain their old plans but have to pay higher rates for Obamacare-mandated changes.
